intro: Pariti glabrum, commonly known as the smooth pariti, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
